definitions.definition: The people living within a political or geographical boundary.
examples: The population of New Jersey will not stand for this!

definitions.definition: The people with a given characteristic.
examples: India has the third-largest population of English-speakers in the world.

definitions.definition: A count of the number of residents within a political or geographical boundary such as a town , a nation or the world .

subdefinitions.definition: The number of living cells in a pattern .

definitions.definition: A collection of organisms of a particular species , sharing a particular characteristic of interest, most often that of living in a given area.
examples: A seasonal migration annually changes the populations in two or more biotopes drastically, many twice in opposite senses.

definitions.definition: A group of units (persons, objects, or other items) enumerated in a census or from which a sample is drawn.
The act of filling initially empty items in a collection .
examples: John clicked the Search button and waited for the population of the list to complete.

main_definition: The people living within a political or geographical boundary.
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) The people with a given characteristic.
A count of the number of residents within a political or geographical boundary such as a town , a nation or the world .
( biology ) A collection of organisms of a particular species , sharing a particular characteristic of interest, most often that of living in a given area.
( statistics ) A group of units (persons, objects, or other items) enumerated in a census or from which a sample is drawn.
( computing ) The act of filling initially empty items in a collection .
